dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky, PAULIE, DUKE (TONY) and ADRIAN are swept along by the adoring crowd. The entourage disappears around the corner. The mood is insanely festive and the multitude of Russian VOICES shouting uncensored praise REVERBERATES down the cement corridors... The Russians are CHANTING "Rocky, Rocky!"

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (TONY)
dialogues.text: You come through like a champ.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: (bellowing) Yo, Rocky, the giant killer of Philadelphia! Way to punch out that friggin’ tomato can, Rocko! We gonna drink a lake of vodka tonight! Rocky looks dazed and turns to Adrian.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: see Adrian? Adrian does not hear him over the CLAMOR of the crowd. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (continuing; louder) «ee Adriant She turns to him just as Rocky's legs buckle and he collapses to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Rocky!!

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (weakly) I'm alright.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (TONY)
dialogues.text: Everybody get back! The stunned crowd surges around the fallen fighter.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Rocko, what's wrong? Get back ya's! Every ounce of strength appears to have been drained from Rocky's body. Rivets of sweat cascade down his - forehead and chest... he shivers slightly.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Somebody please get a doctor!

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Everythin's spinnin’.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Don't get up. Paulie, get some help.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (helplessly) Why can't I get up... my legs feel cold.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (TONY)
dialogues.text: Everybody get the hell back. The man needs air!

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I ain't never felt like this.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: You're going to a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: No hospital. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: What are you talking about, you've got to go. Two Russians in military uniforms break through the crowd with a stretcher. They yell at the crowd in Russian. :

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I'm good, everything's good -- just tired, real tired.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Please let's just make sure, please.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: «+. Whatever you say, Mick. Adrian's face becomes ultra-concerned when she hears Rocky address her as Mick. They place him on the stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: {continuing) «+. Stay with me.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: I'm here. They carry him away.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT, (MOSCOW)
dialogues.text: The urban hospital sits massive and impassive in the center of the Russian metropolis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gloomy area is deserted. Paulie paces and smokes.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: I need a drink. How long they gonna take? Duke (Tony) shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: (continuing) What the hell's wrong with him?! He always come through before. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (TONY)
dialogues.text: The man took the worse beatin’ I ever seen, Paulie looks at him and lights another cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: INT, TESTING LAB
dialogues.text: The tiny room is very dark and totally sparse except for Rocky, who sits on a barber-type chair. Twenty or more electrodes are fastened to his forehead and temple region, His brow is stitched and bandaged. His eyes are terribly bruised. . The beam from a single bright strobe hangs six feet away, directly in front of Rocky's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This dim area is filled with a small bank of monitors that are fed by a group of impressive-looking computers.

dialogues.speaker: INT, NEXT ROOM
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN: an array of ten different angles of Rocky's brain is undergoing analysis. Adrian stands beside DR. KROSKIN (forty-five, medium height, glasses, keen expression). Beside the doctor are two Soviet assistants,

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: How are you feeling, Rocky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The strobe flashes brightly into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: With all these wires, I feel like a radio. I'm gettin’ tired here, Adrian. cur TO;  » 10 ll 12 13 14 10/27/89 ‘ 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She faces the Doctor, whose eye snatches a glimpse at Adrian.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: How much longer?

dialogues.speaker: DR. KRUSKIN
dialogues.text: (accent) The test will be complete soon.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: (into the microphone) Not much longer, Rocky. (to Dr. Kruskin) Why did he fall down like that?

dialogues.speaker: DR. KRUSKIN
dialogues.text: We will soon know. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: INT, TESTING LAB
dialogues.text: He squirms in the chair.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I don't wanna miss the plane.

dialogues.speaker: STROBE LIGHT
dialogues.text: The strobe flashes a blinding glare into the lens and the scene cuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is very dark except for an eye-level bank of viewing screens (24" TV monitors),

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at the images. 10 11 12 13 14  15 16 10/27/89

dialogues.speaker: DR. KRUSKIN
dialogues.text: 15 He ENTERS the SHOT and points to a colorful section of a normal brain.

dialogues.speaker: DR. KRUSKIN
dialogues.text: Instead of his brain reacting ina normal pattern such as this, the information is received in a distorted fashion.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: He gestures to an jdentical image of Rocky's brain. Rocky enters the room. Everyone freezes in anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: How'd I do? Didn't find nothin', right?

dialogues.speaker: DR. KRUSKIN
dialogues.text: Do you wish to talk informally?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Tell him, please.

dialogues.speaker: DR. KRUSKIN
dialogues.text: (pointing to the graphs} Because of the many violent strikes to the head, you have developed a condition called “Cayum Septum Pellucidum," & hole in the membrane separating the ventricles. The brain surface neurons in this area have also at? been traumatized. jot ROCKY ee (unnerved) <~ Adrian, what's this all mean?

dialogues.speaker: DR. KRUSKIN
dialogues.text: You have suffered damage to the brain. The tests show the motor responses are impaired as well as memory. 16 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I remember everythin'. Ask me somethin’, I've still got my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tests have concluded...

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: ++. I heard, yeah, so when does this get better?

dialogues.speaker: DR. KRUSKIN
dialogues.text: Better? I'm sorry to say this, but you have irreversible damage.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I feel okay -- I feel good.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Rocky, you've got to retire.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Retire? I don't wanna retire -- not like this, not in no office. I just fought the best fight of my life, I just did that!

dialogues.speaker: . ADRIAN
dialogues.text: You have severe head trauma.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: He could be wrong, anybody can be wrong!

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: I don't think he is.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: He's not God. Only God ain't wrong! TI don't care, I gotta see other doctors, I don't even know his name. Adrian, a fighter's supposed to go down... Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Rocky?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: «+. supposed to go down in the ring, not like this, not in here. It's not supposed to end like this. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DR. KRUSKIN
dialogues.text: To continue to fight could be fatal!

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Rocky, we're secure, you don't need to go on proving anything, you've done it all.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Does it get worse? I seen a lotta punchy guys walkin’ around not knowin' what's goin' on, can that happen to me?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Will it get worse?

dialogues.speaker: DR. KRUSKIN
dialogues.text: In most average cases it can be progressive, but there's nothing average about your husband, he is a great sportsman. Adrian goes over and embraces Rocky.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: (softly) No one has to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky walks out with Adrian and Dr. Kruskin. Paulie and Duke (Tony) approach.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (TONY)
dialogues.text: How ya feelin', champ?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Real good.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Beautiful. So, Rocko, let's blow this country before they make us join the Army. Rocky nods.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hey, Rocko... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: PAOLIE
dialogues.text: Helluva way to spend New Year's, huh?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: se. yeah, They disappear around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 18
dialogues.text: A commercial jet is seen soaring through the night. A full moon is seen in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA DOLLIES BACK among all the sleeping passen- - gers in first class. It ROLLS PAST Paulie and Duke (Tony) who are fast asleep. Paulie has five empty miniature Scotch bottles on the fold-out tray. The CAMERA ARRIVES at Rocky and Adrian. He is awake, so is she. They are both lost in deep thought. Rocky's head leans on Adrian's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Adrian...

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Think things is gonna change between us?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I don't care none what happened to me, just so nothin’ ever happens to us.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: It won't. Rocky closes his eyes and strokes her hair as the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 747 jetliner's wheels BELCH smoke as the massive machine sets down on the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The area is crammed with a swirling potpourri of rabid fans. Young children, Like many of the crowd, hold up banners and signs welcoming their hero home. CUT TO;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the reception gate a herd of REPORTERS and minicam crews wait for Rocky to get off the plane. cUuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky, Adrian, Paulie (wearing an American flag around - his shoulders), and Duke (Tony) exit the plane. Rocky is wearing sunglasses to hide the bruising. Rocky is overwhelmed by the reception.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: (gestures to the Reporters) I called ahead. Nice turnout, whatta ya think? Rocky approaches the Reporters.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Ya don't think they know.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: They don't know.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE AIRPORT OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: leading ROCKY JR. A Security Guard is with her. The official approaches Rocky. Rocky Jr. runs to his ather. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bl 24

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY JR.
dialogues.text: Dad, Dad!

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Don't say anything to him yet, okay?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: C'mere, Slugger! How's Superboy? ROCKY JR. I'm fine. Hi, Mom, hi, Uncle Paulie.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: {kisses him) Hello, sweetheart. ROCKY JR. Your face looks sore.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: foo much shavin'.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Mr. Balboa, I'm Sheila Downs. I'm with Airport Security. We'll help you through this crowd. There's a press reception inside, of course. The entourage is nearing the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ll. 24 24a * Suddenly a high school marching BAND steps INTO VIEW. * They are playing a rowdy fight song.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Yo, Rocko, ya gotta band meetin’ ya.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: This wasn't scheduled, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: I don't know. :

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Don't look at me, I didn't do nothin'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bl 24a 11/6/89 12. CONTINUED: 24a Rocky and company look up as a limousine appears through the center of the band. Written on the side of the limo is "G.W. DUKE PROMOTIONS.“ A VOICE booms from a LOUDSPEAKER in the limo's grill.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: {booming) Rocky Balboa, stay where you are! This is George Washington Duke welcoming you home, champ! ROCKY JR. This is radical!

dialogues.speaker: . DUKE
dialogues.text: People, please hold it where you are! A large black man in his fifties approaches. His name is GEORGE WASHINGTON DUKE, raconteur, playboy and ultra successful fight promoter. At his side is his assistant and yes man par excellence, MERLIN SHEETS. He is in his late thirties or early forties, he is of average or slightly below average height. Even though he has a perennial smile stretched across his face, his ~ eyes radiate a pit bull tenacity. Beside Merlin is a burly black heavyweight fighter named UNION CANE. With his close cropped or shaved head Cane radiates a power- ful presence, he is in his middle thirties, a civil man.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: You did such an extraordinary job, champ, you deserve a royal welcome home, and here it is! Congratulations for a wonderful performance, champ.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Thanks -- this is Adrian.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Hello. Rocky, it's cold here and you have people waiting.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: This way please...

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Don't wanna hold up the procession, but I did wanna be the first to welcome back Philly's favorite son and his lovely wife. Please go on, we'll see you inside, champ! cUT TO:  bl 2483 11/6/89 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky is seated at a table with twenty microphones in front of him. TV lights glare harshly in his face. Adeian is beside him, Paulie and son behind. Four members of the PRESS are present.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Rocky, there were rumors of some physical complications after the fight. Rocky is at a loss.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: That's what they are, rumors. He's very healthy.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Rocky, is there going to be a rematch?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: No thanks. I sees a dog in the audience, that's a cute animal!

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: (to Adrian) Nobody ever asks me a question. Duke, Cane, and Merlin enter the room.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Rocky, recently the American Medical Association said that prize fighting should be banned. Do you agree with the doctors?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Absolutely, doctors should never fight.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: (steps forward) Champ, that was a beautiful answer! That's right, keep the doctors out of the ring! Now I would like to digress from the questions and present a little exciting proposition for the media. Now everyone in this city and certainly the world of sports knows my reputation of promoting some of the finest extravaganzas in this country...

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: (steps up) »»- In the world. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 248  bl

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: +e. Modesty's a virtue, Merlin, but hell yes, the world over! So now with the press present, I want to ask you to be the rambunctious, flamboyant sportsman we've come to know you to be and offer this man here, Union Cane, the opportunity to challenge you for the Heavyweight Championship of the World. Cane steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, how ya doin', Union?

dialogues.speaker: CANE
dialogues.text: (shyly) Good.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Isn't this bad timing, Duke, the Man just got off the plane!!

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Timing's the essence of life, gentlemen. And what I propose is not just an ordinary title fight, but an international superstar event.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: The first of its kind! None like it!

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: I'm layin' out the groundwork for a fantastic extravaganza. A super mighty fight to be held in Japan that will be called “Lettin' it go in Tokyo." I've been breakin alotta bread with my little Japanese brothers an' they have put their millions where their mouth is! So brother, what I have on paper is the largest guarantee ever offered to a champion on this earth! Man, they do love you over there -- Rocky Balboa, America's Dream Machine! (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: People, ain't it incredible that only in America could a black man and a white man both rise from oppression, rise from poverty to join hands in an unbelievable international event like "Lettin' it go in Tokyo." Yes, only in America! So, Rocky, all I need is your blessing and you and Union Cane will be part of the richest event to ever hit the Orient!

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: No, I don't think that's possible.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Mrs. Balboa, you're not against your husband being an international ambassador of sports?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: No, but I am against my husband getting hurt anymore.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Well, he looks prime-time to me.

dialogues.speaker: MERLIN
dialogues.text: The "Dream Machine" never looked better.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: Ain't that the truth. That's what you are to folks, the “Dream Machine," a world class champ. And a world class champ's gotta be part of the planet, so can I say that in front of the press here -- Balboa vs. Cane in Japan for the title?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: No you can't. Rocky tenses.

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: (to Rocky) The people are waiting for you to step up, brother.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: My husband is retiring. He's decided he really has no more to prove. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: REPORTERS
dialogues.text: Rocky, is this true? Are you giving up the title?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess so. ROCKY JR. Dad, don't quit. You won't be famous anymore.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Can I say somethin'?

dialogues.speaker: DUKE
dialogues.text: (draws closer) A battle between you and Cane would be worth a fortune, it's prime time! We all live once, retire? Hell, when we die we're gonna retire for an eternity, don't rush it!

dialogues.speaker: REPORTERS
dialogues.text: Let him talk.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (to reporters) Y'know Mickey use to say about fightin’... (pause) "It's mind over matter, until it don't matter." (to Adrian) I know I wouldn't have been doin' good all these years without my Adrian, she always kept my mind right. Thanks. (to the press) And yo, thanks to youse ‘cause except for a couple of shots now an‘ then ya's been really fair to me. Thanks, it's been great. Rocky leans over and kisses Adrian, then stands. embraces Duke. (Tony)

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Thanks, Duke. (Tony) Rocky nods and turns to his son.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Wanna go home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A limousine pulls up to the beautiful home and the family gets out. The exterior of the home is done up with Christmas decorations.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: We better get inside. Your resistance is low right now. ROCKY JR. Dad, I figured out I want to be a radio announcer.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: What station ya gonna be on? ROCKY JR. S.T.U.N. -~ that's nuts spelled backwards. Rocky puts his arm around his son and wife and walks towards the house... He pauses and stares up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: {takes a deep breath) Hey, Junior, did ya ever notice how good New Year's smells. Gotta be the best smell of the year. ROCKY JR. Except for birthdays.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, birthdays have a great odor too. They move off... Paulie struggles with the luggage.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: And carryin' bags stinks most of all.

dialogues.speaker: LIMO DRIVER
dialogues.text: (brightly) I'll get those, sir!

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Callin' me a weaklin'? The Limo Driver freezes as Paulie moves past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky carries his bags into the room. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY JR.
dialogues.text: Dad, come on down to my room, okay.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, in a minute. Rocky sets the bags down and rubs his temples. He glances at some framed pictures of himself and some with Adrian from years before.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Good picture... Rocky goes to a bedside table and picks up a phone book (yellow pages). He flips it open to no place in particular.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (continuing; reading) St. Mary's Plumbing, 255-1268. He covers it with his hand and recites from memory.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (continuing) St. Mary's Plumbing, 255 -- 2, l, no ~~ 2, 1, 2... He clenches his fist in Frustration and closes the book. He exits. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adrian enters and sees Paulie pacing at the far end of the dining table. He has an official-looking letter clutched tensely in his hand. The dining room is quite moody with the only light coming from a six-foot wide chandelier located nearly head-height above the twelve- foot table.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The CAMERA PANS with Paulie as he absently siips a half-finished bottle of beer into the pocket of his baggy pants.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: {opening a second letter) This can't be right, WIDE SHOT over Paulie. Adrian opens the door fully. Paulie freezes.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Paulie, what's wrong? Who's the letter from?

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Nobody, just a rotten bill. PANNING Paulie. He moves out of the dining room.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: The CAMERA SLOWLY MOVES IN TOWARD a thin sliver of light that angles out of the door in front of Rocky Jr.'s room. VOICES are heard from behind the ajar door.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY JR., (0.S.)
dialogues.text: {radio voice) Hello, everybody in radio land. Tonight I had a special interview with Rocky Balboa. Mr. Balboa, is it true you're really not going to fight anymore?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY JR.
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Why? How do ya spell that? No, just kiddin'.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY JR., (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Balboa, don't get mad or anything, but you sound different since you've come home. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: How different?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY JR., (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Different -- y'know, a little different.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I don't sound too bad, do 1? ROCKY JR. No, just different.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY JR.
dialogues.text: as his father brushes his hair from his eyes. The room is dark except for a light on the bedside table. The light is in the shape of a boxing glove.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Different, huh, well, y'know what the "B" side of life is? ROCKY JR. No, what's the "B" side?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: The "A" side is good, "B" side is kinda the throwaway. * ROCKY JR. What's it mean? *

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: It means y'know, that when ya fight * each fight takes a piece out of ya * that can't never be put back. * ROCKY JR. Is there something wrong, Dad? *

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Me?... No, not really. Ah, I just wanted ya to know that sometimes ya might be thinkin’ I'm actin' different, y'know maybe like one of your kid friends instead of ya father, but I am ya-father an' I love ya more than what's legal. eee Oe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky hears angry voices coming from downstairs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY JR.
dialogues.text: Why's mom yelling?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I dunno. Hey, get some sleep, it's good for ya bones. Rocky turns out the light.

dialogues.speaker: INT, ROCKY'S MANSION
dialogues.text: Adrian is pacing furiously as she berates Paulie, who is standing at the bar. Adrian holds a handful of crumbled papers in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: You deserve the worst for this! The worst, Paulie!

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Ya think I did it on purpose?!?!

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: It wasn't your money! It was Rocky's!! Do you know what you've cost us? Everything!!

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: You wanna get hysterical, I don't need this. Paulie starts to move off. PAULIE . (continuing) It was an accident. I didn't think all this would happen.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Don't you dare walk away! You manage to give our life away an' it's just another minor problem to you? Do you understand the seriousness of this? Answer me!!

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: I understand it! I understand the whole friggin’ thing! Ya accountant's a thief, not me! cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky walks in and catches the full impact of Paulie's tirade.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: I done what I thought was right. Good intentions, right!? (yells) So don't blame me, I wanna kill the guy more than anybody. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Adrian, what's goin’ on?

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: She's puttin’ it all on me. cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocky Jr., hidden half in the shadows, steps up to the balcony railing and listens.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: You're not turning this around!

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: What'd you do, Paulie?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: So why didn't you show it to Rocky?!

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: ‘Cause he was busy, his mind was on the fight!!

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: He signed it!

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: (bellows) I figured he would've signed it anyway!!

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: You could've asked me. He didn't ask me because it would've been beneath him. He lost it all. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bl

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: (screams) It ain't all my friggin’ fault!

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: (screams) For once in your life be a man and shut up! It's gone, Rocky, the money's gone. cUuT TO: INT. ROCKY'S MANSION - STAIRWAY - NIGHT 34c Rocky's Jr.'s face turns ashen upon hearing this and the SCENE ENDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city looks bleak on this day.

dialogues.speaker: INT, LAW OFFICE
dialogues.text: Secretary sits at her desk typing away. The CAMERA PANS OFF the young woman and TRACKS TO the glass-front office of attorney MICHAEL MORAN, an attractive lawyer in his early forties. Rocky and Adrian are also in the * conference room.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: What you did was illegal, it's the same as stealing.

dialogues.text: (loudly) I ain't a thief, I was conned into it, Rocko. I never took a friggin' dime!

dialogues.text: You just let someone else steal it.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: How'd the money go so fast?

dialogues.speaker: MORAN
dialogues.text: Easy, your accountant got involved * in some very large pieces of * commercial real estate... ® (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MORAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: «». planning to flip them quick for a huge profit and have your money back before you noticed it was gone. Unfortunately for everyone, the deals fell through and payment in the millions was due.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (pacing) What can ya do? Nothin'?

dialogues.speaker: MORAN
dialogues.text: Eight criminal acts have been filed, but due to the tremendous debt payment on the property and six years of delinquent tax returns and overdue mortgage payments, and I see no other way than to file for bankruptcy.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Mortgages? The house was fully paid for.

dialogues.speaker: MORAN
dialogues.text: Apparently not. There's nearly $400,000 still outstanding. How was this guy allowed to operate so unsupervised?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: I trusted him.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: What do we do? How are we ever supposed to get out from this debt?

dialogues.speaker: MORAN
dialogues.text: Why not a couple more fights?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: No, he's retired,

dialogues.speaker: MORAN
dialogues.text: Unretire.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MORAN
dialogues.text: Commercial endorsements, there's a possibility. 25. 36 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: MORAN
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: ‘Cause I ain't no charity case. All I got, I got with my hands. I'm just a fighter, that's what I used to do. (pause) I ain't gonna do things, sell things an' have these people laughin' ‘cause they know I'm broke. Adrian wants me to, but me, I wanna just be in a gym, just doin' what I like. Things happen for reasons... (long pause) we. I'm just a fighter, that's all I can do. Paulie stands.

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: I ain't takin' all the heat for this. I thought I was doin’ smart business, you trusted him.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Smart business?!

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: Everythin's a gamble, but ya don't know that ‘cause ya been livin' in this friggin' fairy tale world where the friggin' air don't move. Ya like a goddamn season that don't change!

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Hey, you don't talk to her like that!

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE
dialogues.text: I ain't no can to be kicked! Everybody forget when she was a queen zero an' you was a bum. I put ya's together, I'm responsible, but nobody ever gives me credit for doin’ nothin'! I never got credit!

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Credit! All I got is gone -- (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -- money to live, money for the kid to go to school so he don't ever have to be like mel See the thing is I seen my family lose the roof over their head -- all those beatin's for nothin’?! “Give ya credit?!" Ya lucky I don't kill ya! Rocky glares at Paulie then turns to Adrian.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY

Paulie sits on the second floor landing as the Auctioneer's VOICE filters upstairs. Paulie sips from a flask. Rocky Jr. enters the room and looks at the crowd. ROCKY JR. Why don't you get out! Get out! (to his mother) It's our house! The boy runs out of the stunned room. Adrian follows. cur TO:

dialogues.text: Hello, champ.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: Putta lotta miles on this garment. She nods. Rocky digs in and pulls out his crushed hat. He slips it on his head and steps up to Adrian,

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (continuing; softly) That's great.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: What is? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: It still fits. He puts his arm around Adrian. They head down the hallway. :

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm gonna go out for awhile. Hey, could ya talk to the kid, he’s mad at me.

dialogues.text: No he's not.

dialogues.text: (exits) Maybe say somethin' to make him feel better. EXT. ANDY'S BAR - NIGAT 41a A pair of hard-core blue-collar construction worker types enter.

dialogues.text: A crowd is gathered around Rocky who is very drunk with his hat tilted back. He sweats profusely as he relives his earlier ring battles with Apollo Creed.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: One jab, two, three! Apollo's doin’ a drum solo on my face! Right, right -- no, it was a left hook. Rocky takes a swill of beer from a bottle on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (continuing) So what was happenin'? Oh, yeah, he's drilling me so I'm seein' birds, hearin' music -- I got this disco goin' in my head -- an' I'm lookin' for an openin'. Apollo's pourin' it on, bang, bang... Rocky moves to the center of the bar room. People are laughing behind his back. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Then I seen itt His ribs -- they got my name on 'em. I gotta get his ribs or I'm outta there. I sees the openin' -- zap -- I throw four lefts an' Apollo bends in half. I know I'm gonna make the bell.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: T'm shot?

dialogues.text: Nice trainin' camp. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: bl

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: How ‘bout everybody here at one time. How ‘bout it? How 'bout everybody on that side of the room take me on. C'mon, make like frogs an' jump me! C'mon, I'm shot! A couple of men smirk in the background.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: {continuing) Ya think I'm funny? I'm a joke? I come off these streets, I took my beatin's, I seen beautiful things around the world an' I talked with important people! I done somethin' with my life! Ya laughed when I came off these streets, now I come back an‘ ya still laugh!

dialogues.text: I don't know how it all happened, Mick, but it did, and I don't know if I can take being down, Ya think I can handle it? I dunno. I sometimes lie to myself, like before I Fight like I weren't scared, but I always had scaredness, you knew that.

dialogues.text: Rocky and

No matter how tough it gets, stand up an' fight! Always keep ya angel's feathers clean...

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY

dialogues.text: Hey, don't say that. I weren't no king, never. I was a pug who caught a break, that's all. Yeah, the money's gone, that's a fact. So what am I supposed to do, kill myself? We lived great for a few years, now we're gonna live like regular people. An’ to tell ya the truth, Paulie -- I dunno, maybe it's crazy, but I think I had most when I had nothin’. (CONTINUED)
CONTINUED: (2) 64a

dialogues.text: Ya want me outta ya life? Maybe ya wanna hang around with some new people.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: (pats him on the shoulder) They say ya a bum, an’ they say I'm punchy. So together we equal an average person -- so I don't need to meet new people. Paulie hugs Rocky and the fighter departs.

Four middle-aged ladies hold a sign that reads, “Welcome Back Home." Rocky and Jimmy are carrying out boxes of clothing. Rocky hoists a box containing trophies.

dialogues.text: Why don't they go find some other accident to stare atl! (to Rocky) Rocko, even if it's my joint, ya an' the sister are welcome to the big bedroom, no charge.

Rocky Jr. is pacing with agitation. There is fear on his face. ROCKY JR. I don't want to! I can't, Mom, I don't know what to do! I can't, Mom. Please don't make me go there. Rocky stands at the door and listens to the animated conversation.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: You have to enroll today. After the first day everyone will get to know you and they'll be your new friends. ROCKY JR. I don't want new friends. Why can't I have my old friends? Why can't Dad fight again and make some money! Why can't he do that?

dialogues.speaker: . ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Because he can't. "ROCKY JR. (overriding) Why'd he have to lose all his money?!

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: Junior, you don't know what you're talking about! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY JR.

dialogues.text: The kid's really startin’ to hate me, right?

dialogues.text: Just talk to him, he's scared.

dialogues.text: I owe him better than this.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY

dialogues.speaker: ADRIAN
dialogues.text: I feel comfortable there, it'll be fine. Rocky kisses her and turns.

dialogues.speaker: ROCKY
dialogues.text: oe. I dunno. (to son) In school, don't look over at the next desk an' cheat...

ROCKY JR. Please, Dad, I don't want to go to this school.

dialogues.text: Ya gotta. ROCKY JR. Why?

dialogues.speaker: PAULIE

Look at this place, my intentions are clear.
